info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:49PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: A narrow band of light to moderate snowfall has developed over northern El Paso county and is drifting off to the south and east. The NAM 4km Nest model has been resolving this the best and shows this eventually moving into across areas of the lower Arkansas River Valley later this evening and into the early morning hours. Some of the soundings have also been displaying an abundance of low level moisture later this evening in and around the Colorado Springs area, which may allow for some patchy freezing drizzle to develop. There could also be some areas of of patchy freezing fog over the higher elevations from Monument Hill to the Palmer Divide. Use caution while driving from Monument and northward to the El Paso County border, as roads may occasionally be slick and icy.
